namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/place" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/Place.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/logicaldevice" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/LogicalDevice.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/specification" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/Specification.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/property" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/Property.xsd"/> <xsd:complexType name="ConnectivityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ConnectivityType represents a Connectivity entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invent:EntityType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="specification" nillable="false" type="invspec:SpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specification holds the Pipe Specification information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="id" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ID of the connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="name" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="description" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of the connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="externalIdentity" nillable="true" type="invent:ExternalIdentityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the explicit identity of the business entity from the perspective of the external participant.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="action" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a specialized action on the Connectivity (or Entity). This is a free form value - based on agreement between external system and the Connectivity Domain-specific Logic. The default values are 'LEASE' and 'TERMINATE'.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="state" nillable="true" type="invspec:InventoryStateEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Lifecycle State of the Connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="startDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start Date of the Connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="endDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>End Date of the Connectivity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="property" nillable="true" type="invprop:PropertyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Property holds the dynamic properties of a Connectivity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="technology" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the type of technology that is intended to be supported by the connectivity. Examples: Optical, SONET, SDH, T-Carrier, E-Carrier, ATM, Frame.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="signal" nillable="true" type="invconn:SignalType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies information about the signal type and transmission speed of the signal the connectivity will be expected to transmit or carry. Signal may be expressed in terms of a transmissionSpeed and/or an industry-recognized or user-defined mnemonic or textual code referred to as the signalCode. For instance, a T-Carrier technology connectivity may support a fixed transmission speed of 1544000 (1.544 Megabits per second). For T-Carrier technology this is known as a signal code of DS1.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="2" name="node" nillable="true" type="invconn:ConnectivityNodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies nodes in the node/edge graph of connectivity. Nodes describe where connectivity terminates, where is 'passes through' how it is routed, and so forth. Each connectivity must specify at least two endpoint nodes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SignalType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies information about the signal type and transmission speed of the signal the connectivity will be expected to transmit or carry. Signal may be expressed in terms of a transmissionSpeed and/or an industry-recognized or user-defined mnemonic or textual code referred to as the signalCode. For instance, a T-Carrier technology connectivity may support a fixed transmission speed of 1544000 (1.544 Megabits per second). For T-Carrier technology this is known as a signal code of DS1.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="transmissionSpeed" nillable="true" type="invconn:TransmissionSpeedType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the speed or bandwidth supported by an entity such as a transmission entity or a device interface in bits per second</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="signalCode" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a mnemonic or textual industry-recognized code for a signal For instance, a T-Carrier technology connectivity that supports a transmission speed of 1.544 megabits per second may also be referred to with a signal code of DS1.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TransmissionSpeedType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the speed or bandwidth supported by an entity such as a transmission entity or a device interface in bits per second. transmissionSpeed is a 'complex' property that is expressed in terms of a minimum speed, a maximum speed, and a nominal speed transmissionSpeed has one of its origins in the MIB-2 standard as "An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second." For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="minSpeed" nillable="true" type="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the minimum transmission speed of a business entity such as a transmission entity or device interface in bits per second when the transmission speed may vary.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="maxSpeed" nillable="true" type="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the maximum transmission speed of a business entity such as a transmission entity or device interface in bits per second when the transmission speed may vary.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="nominalSpeed" nillable="true" type="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the nominal transmission speed of a business entity such as a transmission entity or device interface in bits per second when the transmission speed may vary.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="unitOfMeasure" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specifies the unit of measure of the transmission speeds of a business entity such as a transmission entity or device interface in bits per second when the transmission speed may vary.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ConnectivityNodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies nodes in the node/edge graph of connectivity. Nodes describe where connectivity terminates, where is 'passes through' how it is routed, and so forth. Each connectivity must specify at least two endpoint nodes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1" name="typeOfNode" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies how the node is designated in a given connectivity . For example, a trail connectivity has two endpoint nodes and optionally intermediate nodes in the connectivity. Therefore the valid types of node can be TERM-A, TERM-Z, INTERMEDIATE. Other type of nodes are also applicable depending on the context.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="location" nillable="true" type="invplace:PlaceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the location where the node is terminated at.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="device" nillable="true" type="invld:LogicalDeviceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the device where the node is terminated at.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" name="adjacentConnectivity" nillable="true" type="invconn:ConnectivityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the connectivity on the other side of this node, if it is known. This data will provide information on how the requested connectivity will be connected on the other side for the given node, in addition to the context of the location and device. The adjacentConnectivity for this node is itself in-turn recursively represented by another connectivity so that the same and complete schema can be reused to describe the connectivity on the other side, and so forth. The levels of detail for the adjacentConnectivity can vary based on specific implementation needs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <!--==== Data Types ====--> <!--==== Entity Criteria Types ====--> <!--==== Enumerations ====--> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invent:EntityType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="specification" nillable="false" type="invspec:SpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specification holds the Logical Device Specification information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="id" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>id holds the unique id of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="name" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="description" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="networkLocationEntityCode" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Holds the denormalized values of the combined PropertyLocation.NetworkLocationCode and the NetworkEntityCode.NetworkLocationEntityCode field values for the logical device, including the '.' delimiter if specified based on the system preference. This attribute will be set by the application by the API call, and used internally in the Logical Device search when the user searches for a device by Network/Entity Location. This field value if specified by a caller will be ignored by the APIs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="deviceIdentifier" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Represents a business meaningful identifier for the Logical Device. This field can be populated if the Logical Device has a propertyLocation value. The API will default this field value if the propertyLocation is given and the caller hasn't specified a value. This field must be unique within all logical devices.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="state" nillable="true" type="invspec:InventoryStateEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Lifecycle State of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="startDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start Date of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="endDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>End Date of the Logical Device</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="property" nillable="true" type="invprop:PropertyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Property holds the dynamic properties of a Logical Device.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <!--TODO: LogicalDeviceType schema definition--> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="DeviceInterfaceType"> <xsd:documentation>Specification holds the Device Interface Specification information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="id" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>id holds the unique id of the Device Interface</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="name" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the Device Interface</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="description" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of the Device Interface</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="state" nillable="true" type="invspec:InventoryStateEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Lifecycle State of the Device Interface</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="startDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start Date of the Device Interface</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="property" nillable="true" type="invprop:PropertyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Property holds the dynamic properties of a Device Interface.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="logicalDevice" nillable="true" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the Logical Device, where this Device Interface is hosted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <!--TODO: DeviceInterfaceType schema definition--> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="LogicalDeviceAccountType"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invent:EntityType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="specification" nillable="false" type="invspec:SpecificationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Specification holds the Logical Device Account Specification information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="id" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>id holds the unique id of the Logical Device Account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="name" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of <xsd:documentation>Description of the Logical Device Account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="state" nillable="true" type="invspec:InventoryStateEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Lifecycle State of the Logical Device Account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="startDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Start Date of the Logical Device Account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="endDate" nillable="true" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>End Date of the Logical Device Account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/configuration" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:configws="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/configuration" xmlns:invcom="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/common" xmlns:invconfig="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/configuration" xmlns:invfault="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/fault" xmlns:invsvc="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/service" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <!--============= Imports Start =================--> <xsd:import namespace="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"/> <!--Local Imports--> <xsd:import namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/common" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/InventoryCommon.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/webservice/fault" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/InventoryFaults.xsd"/> namespace="http://xmlns.oracle.com/communications/inventory/configuration" schemaLocation="http://localhost:9011/UIMServiceFulfillment/UIMServiceFulfillmentHTTP?WSDL/Configuration.xsd"/> <!--==== Message Types ====--> <xsd:complexType name="GetConfigurationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>GetConfigurationRequestType holds the request information containing the Entity and Entity Configuration criteria.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="searchOptions" nillable="false" type="configws:GetConfigurationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The service search Options</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType abstract="true" name="GetConfigurationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>TODO</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invcom:InventoryRequestType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="responseLevel" type="configws:ConfigurationResponseLevelEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Determines if the EntityType in the response should contain child-Entity Configuration (along with child configuration items). If ENTITY_CONFIGURATION_EXPANDED is selected, the search will print the assigned resource information and if the assigned resource is a Service, then it will look inside the Services and retrieve its configuration and its configuration items. If a configuration item as a child service assigned to it, then the search will recursively retrieve its service and service configuration information. If ENTITY_CONFIGURATION is selected, the search will print the assigned resource information and if the assigned resource is a Service, then it will look inside the Services and retrieve its configuration and its configuration items. If a configuration item as a child service assigned to it, then the search will NOT recursively retrieve its service and service configuration information. Default is ENTITY_CONFIGURATION.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="configSearchOption" nillable="true" type="configws:ConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Current State of the Service</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="GetServiceConfigurationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>GetServiceConfigurationRequestType holds the request information containing the Service and Service Configuration criteria.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:GetConfigurationType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="GetConfigurationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>GetConfigurationResponseType holds the response of the GetConfiguration operation. This returns the top level entity and the entire tree of configurations as an array.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invcom:InventoryResponseType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="service" nillable="false" type="invsvc:ServiceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="GetConfigurationFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Fault type to return any business faults within Get Configuration operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invfault:InventoryFaultType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType abstract="true" name="ConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SearchOption</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="entityNote" nillable="false" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType abstract="true" name="ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ConfigurationSearchOption1</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceConfigurationSearchByEntityId"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>...</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="entityId" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the service to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceConfigurationSearchByVersionNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>...</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="entityId" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the service to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="versionNumber" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The versionNumber of the configuration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceConfigurationSearchByConfigId"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>...</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="configurationId" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the configuration to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceConfigurationSearchByConfigStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>...</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="entityId" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the service to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="configurationStatus" nillable="false" type="invconfig:ConfigurationStateEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The configuration version state (ex: in Progress, designed, issue, pending cancel, completed, cancelled).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceConfigurationSearchByEffectiveDate"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>...</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceConfigurationSearchOption"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="entityId" nillable="false" type="xs:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The id of the service to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="effectiveDate" nillable="false" type="xs:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date that services as a frame of reference for the service configuration to get.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="UpdateConfigurationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>UpdateConfigurationStateRequestType holds the request for Update Service Configuration State Web Service operation</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="configws:ServiceFulfillmentRequestType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceCriteria" nillable="true" type="invsvc:ServiceCriteriaType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Criteria to uniquely identify a Service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="configurationCriteria" nillable="true" type="invconfig:ConfigurationCriteriaType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Criteria to uniquely identify a Service Configuration version.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="configurationAction" nillable="true" type="invconfig:ConfigurationActionEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Action that needs to be taken on the configuration.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceAction" nillable="true" type="invsvc:ServiceActionEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Action that needs to be taken on the Service</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="stateChangePolicy" type="invsvc:StateChangePolicyEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>State change policy for the Service Configuration Items.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="UpdateConfigurationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>UpdateConfigurationStateResponseType holds the response of the UpdateServiceConfigurationState Web Service operation. This return the created/updated Service tree.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invcom:InventoryResponseType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="service" nillable="false" type="invsvc:ServiceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Service information with/without configuration items.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="UpdateConfigurationFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Fault type to return any business faults within Update Service Configuration State Web Service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invfault:InventoryFaultType"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ServiceFulfillmentRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ServiceFulfillmentRequestType defines the base type for Requests that will be used for Service Fulfillment. All the attributes that are defined at the Service Fulfillemnt request level are defined here.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="invcom:InventoryRequestType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element default="true" minOccurs="1" name="expandedResponse" nillable="false" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>expandedResponse determines of the ServiceType in the response should contain Configuration Items (along with child configuration items). If true, the whole Service tree is returned. If false, Configuration Items are omitted. Default is false.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <!--==== Elements ====--> <xsd:element name="getConfigurationRequest" type="configws:GetConfigurationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element for input for locating the specific entity configuration entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getConfigurationResponse" type="configws:GetConfigurationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element to represent the information returned for locating the specific configuration entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getConfigurationFault" type="configws:GetConfigurationFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element to represent the information returned as a fault if for locating the specific configuration entity has errors.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateConfigurationRequest" type="configws:UpdateConfigurationRequestType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element is used for inputs for UpdateServiceConfiguration operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateConfigurationResponse" type="configws:UpdateConfigurationResponseType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element represents the information returned for updateConfigurationResponse operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateConfigurationFault" type="configws:UpdateConfigurationFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The element represents the information of errors returned for UpdateServiceConfiguration operation failure.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:simpleType name="ConfigurationResponseLevelEnum"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Defines valid values for Configuration Response Detail Level.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="ENTITY_CONFIGURATION"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Selecting this option the search will print the assigned resource information and if the assigned resource is a Service, then it will print the Services information (including the Place and Party), but it will not print the configuration information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="ENTITY_CONFIGURATION_EXPANDED"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Selecting this option the search will print the assigned resource information and if the assigned resource is a Service, then it will look inside the Services and retrieve its configuration and its configuration items. If a configuration item as a child service assigned to it, then the search will recursively retrieve its service and service configuration information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:schema>
